result.execSummary:
The defendant Tabiano T Avila was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including angermanagement counseling and psych evaluation. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Defendant Tabiano T Avila in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Defendant Tabiano T Avila in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
PSI reviewed by parties, 1 correction made, no additions.

15CF927
BTC: Ct. 1: Sentence withheld, 5 yrs. probation consective to Cts. 3 & 4 in 17CF516.
Ct. 2: Sentence withheld, 5 yrs. probation consective to Cts. 3 & 4 in 17CF516.

17CF516
BTC: Ct. 1: Sentence withheld, 3 yrs. probation, consecutive to Cts. 3 & 4.
Ct. 3: 3 1/2 yrs., 1 1/2 yrs IC, 2 yrs. ES consecutive to Ct. 4.
Ct. 4: 10 yrs, 5 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES.
Ct. 5: Sentence withheld, 3 yrs. probation, consecutive to Cts. 3 & 4.
Ct. 12: Sentence withheld, 3 yrs. probation, consecutive to Cts. 3 & 4.
Ct. 13: Sentence withheld, 3 yrs. probation consecutive to Cts. 3 & 4.

Conditions:
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
AODA assessment.
No contact with victim in 17CF516 C.R..
Restitution in 17CF516 set at $500.00 to victim.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Anger Management counseling.
Psych evaluation.
DL revoked 12 months as to Ct. 12.
No driving unless duly licensed.
Pay court costs, costs of supervision, surcharges.
DNA sample.

FAW/VOTE.

Eligible for CIP and SAP on Ct. 3 once initial incarceration on Ct. 4 is served.

Charges as in the attached information. Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant may not leave home except for attorney appointments and court dates, and nobody other than mother is allowed in home. Defendant may not possess a cell phone. Make all court appearances on time.  Defendant may search for work, attend Gateway and have visitation with daughter, S.G., pursuant to Family Court orders.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Tabiano T Avila in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Defendant Tabiano T Avila in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.

BTC: $30,000.00 cash bond to be set; same conditions as previously set. Vacate warrant  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.
IN CUSTODY

**PLUS $9,000 CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH SANDRA GARCIA, D.O.B. 6-18-1958.**
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant may not possess a cell phone.  No contact with any gang members.  No internet access.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Defendant may not leave home except for attorney appointments and court dates, and nobody other than mother is allowed in home. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 12-1-2015:  Defendant may search for work, attend Gateway and have visitation with daughter, S.G., pursuant to Family Court orders.**
